com.penthera.virtuososdk.client.drm

Class VirtuosoDrmSessionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.penthera.virtuososdk.client.drm.VirtuosoDrmSessionManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.penthera.virtuososdk.drm.KeyFetcher.KeyResponseHandler
    public class VirtuosoDrmSessionManager extends java.lang.Object implements com.penthera.virtuososdk.drm.KeyFetcher.KeyResponseHandler
    Manages a DRM session, retrieving stored keys for offline viewing or retrieving keys whilst online.

    • Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      VirtuosoDrmSessionManager 
      VirtuosoDrmSessionManager(android.content.Context context, java.util.UUID uuid, IAsset asset, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> optionalKeyRequestParameters, android.os.Looper playbackLooper, android.os.Handler eventHandler, VirtuosoDrmSessionManager.EventListener eventListener)
      Create a DrmSessionManager to be used during media playback.
      public VirtuosoDrmSessionManager(android.content.Context context, java.util.UUID uuid, IAsset asset, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> optionalKeyRequestParameters, android.os.Looper playbackLooper, android.os.Handler eventHandler, VirtuosoDrmSessionManager.EventListener eventListener) throws UnsupportedDrmException
      Create a DrmSessionManager to be used during media playback.
      Parameters:
      context - The context to be used by the manager.
      uuid - The UUID of the drm scheme currently only supports widevine UUIDS.WIDEVINE_UUID.
      asset - The IAsset that any license requests will be made for.
      optionalKeyRequestParameters - An optional map of parameters to pass as the last argument to MediaDrm.getKeyRequest(byte[], byte[], String, int, HashMap). May be null.
      playbackLooper - The looper associated with the media playback thread. When using ExoPlayerV2 this can be null.
      eventHandler - A handler to use when delivering events to eventListener. May be null if delivery of events is not required
      eventListener - A listener of events. May be null if delivery of events is not required.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedDrmException
      VirtuosoDrmSessionManager 
      VirtuosoDrmSessionManager(android.content.Context context, java.util.UUID uuid, java.lang.String remoteAssetId, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> optionalKeyRequestParameters, android.os.Looper playbackLooper, android.os.Handler eventHandler, VirtuosoDrmSessionManager.EventListener eventListener)
      Create a DrmSessionManager to be used during media playback.
      public VirtuosoDrmSessionManager(android.content.Context context, java.util.UUID uuid, java.lang.String remoteAssetId, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> optionalKeyRequestParameters, android.os.Looper playbackLooper, android.os.Handler eventHandler, VirtuosoDrmSessionManager.EventListener eventListener) throws UnsupportedDrmException
      Create a DrmSessionManager to be used during media playback. This Constructor should only be used if the Asset has nt been added to the SDK. That is; The asset is being streamed directly from your catalog.
      Parameters:
      context - The context to be used by the manager.
      uuid - The UUID of the drm scheme currently only supports widevine UUIDS.WIDEVINE_UUID.
      remoteAssetId - The Id of the asset as set by you during creation of an IAsset (The id of the asset in your catalog).
      optionalKeyRequestParameters - An optional map of parameters to pass as the last argument to MediaDrm.getKeyRequest(byte[], byte[], String, int, HashMap). May be null.
      playbackLooper - The looper associated with the media playback thread. When using ExoPlayerV2 this can be null.
      eventHandler - A handler to use when delivering events to eventListener. May be null if delivery of events is not required
      eventListener - A listener of events. May be null if delivery of events is not required.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedDrmException

      Gets an MediaCrypto for the open session.
      public android.media.MediaCrypto getMediaCrypto()
      Gets an MediaCrypto for the open session.

      This method may be called when the manager is in the following states: STATE_OPENED, STATE_OPENED_WITH_KEYS

      Returns:
      An MediaCrypto for the open session.

      Gets the current state of the session.

      Gets the current state of the session.
      Returns:

      onKeyResponse 
      void onKeyResponse(java.lang.String cache_id, byte[] key, java.lang.Exception error)
      Called when the KeyFetcher completes.
      public void onKeyResponse(java.lang.String cache_id, byte[] key, java.lang.Exception error)
      Description copied from interface: com.penthera.virtuososdk.drm.KeyFetcher.KeyResponseHandler
      Called when the KeyFetcher completes. On success the keysetId is passed back in the key parameter. On failure the key will be null and the error parameter will detail the Exception.
      Specified by:
      onKeyResponse in interface com.penthera.virtuososdk.drm.KeyFetcher.KeyResponseHandler
      Parameters:
      cache_id - On Success the id to use in the cache. null on failure or if license can not be persisted.
      key - On Success the keysetId of the key in MediaDrm. null on failure.
      error - On Failure the Exception. On Success it will be null.
      onProvisioned 
      void onProvisioned()
       
      public void onProvisioned()

      Opens the session, possibly asynchronously.
      public void open(IDrmInitData drmInitData)
      Opens the session, possibly asynchronously.
      Parameters:

      requiresSecureDecoderComponent 
      boolean requiresSecureDecoderComponent(java.lang.String mimeType)
      Whether the session requires a secure decoder for the specified mime type.
      public boolean requiresSecureDecoderComponent(java.lang.String mimeType)
      Whether the session requires a secure decoder for the specified mime type.

      Normally this method should return MediaCrypto.requiresSecureDecoderComponent(String), however in some cases implementations may wish to modify the return value (i.e. to force a secure decoder even when one is not required).

      This method may be called when the manager is in the following states: STATE_OPENED, STATE_OPENED_WITH_KEYS

      Returns:
      Whether the open session requires a secure decoder for the specified mime type.
      setLooper 
      void setLooper(android.os.Looper looper)
      Set the Looper that should be used with the internal MediaDrm Handler.
      public void setLooper(android.os.Looper looper)
      Set the Looper that should be used with the internal MediaDrm Handler. The Looper is the one associated with the media playback thread it is usually obtained by a call to com.google.android.exoplayer.ExoPlayer#getPlaybackLooper(). However, if you are using ExoPlayer Version 2 then this will be passed to you by the ExoPlayer Library when they acquire a session with the DRM Manager.
      Parameters:
      looper - The Looper associated with the media playback thread.
